title: Latest Texas sports
text:
Latest Texas sports - KLTV.com-Tyler, Longview, Jacksonville, Texas | ETX News Member Center: 
ANGELS-RANGERS 
Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels 
ARLINGTON, Texas (AP) - The Texas Rangers clinched a wild-card spot and moved to the cusp of the AL West title, with Adrian Beltre's three-run double backing Derek Holland in a 5-3 victory over the Los Angeles Angels on Thursday night. 
The Rangers (87-72), in the playoffs for the first time since 2012 after a 95-loss season, are a win or a Houston loss away from their first division title since winning two straight and going to the World Series in 2010-11. 
The Angels can't defend their AL West championship, but still have a shot at the second wild card with three games left. Los Angeles (83-76) is a game behind the Astros and tied with Minnesota, which beat Cleveland 4-2. 
Holland (4-3) allowed three hits and three runs in 6 1-3 innings for his first win since Sept. 5. 
LAMAR-SE LOUISIANA 
Sutton scores late TD; SE Louisiana beats Lamar 30-27 
HAMMOND, La. (AP) - Kody Sutton had a 1-yard touchdown run on fourth down with 1:19 remaining to help Southeastern Louisiana beat Lamar 30-27 on Thursday night. 
Sutton's go-ahead score came at the end of a 17-play, 79-yard drive, which included two fourth-down conversions. Lamar turned it over on downs on its final possession. 
D'Shaie Landor threw for 283 yards and one touchdown, and ran for two scores for Southeastern Louisiana (3-1, 2-0 Southland). 
Southeastern Louisiana had a 13-0 lead but Lamar scored 17 unanswered points. 
Rodney Randle returned a kickoff 87 yards to give Lamar a 24-16 lead. But Xavier Roberson returned the ensuing kickoff 59 yards and Landor capped the short drive with a 5-yard touchdown run to pull to 24-23 at the end of the third quarter. 
Kade Harrington ran for 152 yards and one touchdown for Lamar (2-2, 1-1). Reggie Begelton had 95 yards receiving to become Lamar's all-time leading receiver. 
ALABAMA ST-TEXAS SOUTHERN 
Richardson, Alabama State beat Texas Southern 41-23 
HOUSTON (AP) - Ellis Richardson threw three touchdown passes and ran for another score to lead Alabama State to a 41-23 victory over Texas Southern on Thursday night. 
Texas Southern took a 23-20 lead late in the third quarter when Averion Hurts found Derrick Griffin in the back of the end zone for a 10-yard touchdown. But Alex Anderson returned the ensuing kickoff 75 yards to give Alabama State a 27-23 lead. 
In the fourth quarter, Richardson had a short touchdown pass to a wide open Brandon Barnes and, less than three minutes later, Khalid Thomas broke a short screen pass for a 46-yard score. 
Richardson had 162 yards passing and 135 yards rushing for Alabama State (2-3, 2-2 Southwestern Athletic Conference). Alex Anderson rushed for 134 yards and a touchdown, and Khalid Thomas had 73 yards receiving and two scores. 
Brad Woodard rushed for 130 yards and a touchdown for Texas Southern (2-3, 1-3). 
NHL RDP 
BROWN LIFTS LIGHTNING PAST STARS 
At Tampa, Florida, J.T. Brown broke a tie with 4:32 left, and Ben Bishop made 23 saves in the Lightning's 3-2 victory over the Dallas Stars. 
Nikita Kucherov and Valtteri Filppula also scored for Tampa Bay. 
Curtis McKenzie and Valeri Nichushkin scored for Dallas, and Karin Lehtonen made 21 saves. 
COWBOYS-RUNNING BACKS 
Christine Michael could be close to joining Dallas backfield 
IRVING, Texas (AP) - Christine Michael is getting work with the first team out of the Dallas backfield, an indication the third-year running back could be close to his debut with the Cowboys. 
Offensive coordinator Scott Linehan said Thursday that Michael was getting "a few more reps this week to see how he's doing." He didn't say whether Michael would be active for the Cowboys (2-1) on Sunday night at New Orleans (0-3). 
Joseph Randle has started all three games after NFL rushing champion DeMarco Murray signed with Philadelphia in free agency. Michael came in a trade with Seattle three weeks ago. 
Randle had 85 yards on his first three carries, but just 2 on his final 11 runs last weekend against Atlanta. Dallas couldn't hold a two-touchdown lead in a 39-28 loss. 
T25-TCU-PLAYERS REINSTATED 
TCU players back after missing 3 games following arrests 
FORT WORTH, Texas (AP) - TCU senior defensive end Mike Tuaua and freshman receiver Andre Petties-Wilson have been reinstated and will be eligible to play against Texas on Saturday. 
The players were arrested last week on charges of robbery-bodily injury after another TCU student told Fort Worth police investigators that the players stole a case of beer while attacking him and his friends. 
The incident happened Sept. 4, a day after the fourth-ranked Horned Frogs beat Minnesota in their season opener. Tuaua and Petties-Wilson played against the Golden Gophers but missed the past three games. 
Coach Gary Patterson said the players had "gone through the judicial process," although a Fort Worth police spokesman said the case hasn't been forwarded to Tarrant County prosecutors. 
Tuaua played all 12 games with five starts last season. 
FALCONS-JONES INJURY 
Falcons' Julio Jones 'good to go' despite new toe injury 
FLOWERY BRANCH, Ga. (AP) - Falcons coach Dan Quinn says he expects receiver Julio Jones will be "ready to rock" on Sunday against the Houston Texans despite a new toe injury. 
Jones participated in Thursday's practice after being held out Wednesday. He also was held out of the Wednesday practice before last week's game at Dallas to rest a sore hamstring. This week he is on the injury report with toe and hamstring injuries. 
Jones said Thursday, "I'm good to go." 
Quinn says he does not know when Jones hurt his toe. He says it is on top of Jones' foot and is not a turf toe injury. 
Jones' 34 catches are the most in NFL history through three games. He also leads the league with 440 yards receiving. Copyright 2015 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.
